result.execSummary:
The defendant Baurice V. Chambers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
** Amended 4/20/16 to reflect 14 months of Probation ordered by the Court. ** 
*** Amended 5/12/16 to reflect 12 months of Probation ordered by the Court, together with a 2-month extension, for a total of 14 months. *** 
**** Amended 7/6/16 to reflect 12 months Probation ordered by the Court. ****

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol. 
Defendant is not to go upon premises of any bars, taverns or businesses whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961. 
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
